alert.note: Alert for Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 14 at 3:28AM CST until December 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND NORTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE AND NORTHWEST TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 6 PM CST this evening. A Red Flag Warning has also been issued from 9 AM to 6 PM CST Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman and Hartley. * 20 Foot Winds...Today, southwest 15 to 25 mph with gust up to 40 mph. Wednesday, southwest 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * Relative Humidity...Today, as low as 12 percent. Wednesday, as low as 9 to 12 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Today, values between 1 and 2 are expected across a majority of the Panhandles, with values of 3 and 4 possible in the western Oklahoma Panhandle and northwest Texas Panhandle. Wednesday, values between 3 and 6 are expected across a majority of the Panhandles, with values of 7 possible in the Oklahoma and northern Texas Panhandles. * Timing...Later this morning through the late afternoon hours. Wednesday morning through the late afternoon hours.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.
